descendents.name: Food
descendents.longDescription:
Your four-legged friend rewards you in many ways. Whether it’s accompanying you on a brisk jog to help you stay in shape, or giving you a cuddle when you need it most, there’s no denying how rewarding a pup can be. Show your appreciation and reward your furry friend with the foods and treats they crave. 

Chewy carries a wide range of delicious dog foods and tasty treats for your precious pup. When it comes to choosing a dog food, you may find all the options overwhelming. Let us help you find the best one with dog food reviews, ingredient information, and personal one-on-one attention when you give us a call at 1-800-672-4399. At Chewy we understand the important role dog food plays. Most of the nutrients your dog needs to stay strong and healthy comes from the food they eat. Chewy carries healthy dog food brands like Blue Buffalo, Royal Canin and Hill’s Prescription Diet. We even carry grain-free and limited ingredient diet dog foods for pups with food allergies or sensitivities. 

Dry dog food is great for the pup parent who is away all day. Dry dog kibble can be left out for your canine companion to snack on throughout the day without spoiling. Dry kibble can also be good for your dog’s teeth -crunchy kibble helps pups get rid of pesky plaque and tartar. Wet dog food often contains flavors and ingredients canines love. Freeze-dried dog food is another option, the limited ingredients in freeze-dried dog food varieties makes it great for pups with sensitive stomachs or food allergies. And you may also consider feeding your pup dehydrated dog food. Dehydrated dog food is created by taking the whole foods found in a raw doggie diet, and slowly heating them until they’re dehydrated. An added bonus: Dehydrated dog food is easy to transport for pup parents who are on the go. And, raw and frozen dog food is another great option. These doggie meals offer your pet the nutrition he was meant to consume in the wild and are rich in protein and typically contain less additives. Whether it’s dry kibble your dog desires or a grain-free wet meal your canine craves, you can find the best dog food brands on Chewy to please his palate and his nutritional needs.

attachmentAssets.shortDescription: How much food do you feed dogs?
attachmentAssets.longDescription: Feed dogs only as much as they need to maintain a healthy weight and good activity levels for their size, age and lifestyle. Amounts will vary widely from dog to dog, but feeding charts on the food you’re feeding should help you determine the right amounts. When in doubt, always consult with your vet about quantities and types of foods to feed, and remember to always feed treats in moderation.

descendents.name: Treats
descendents.longDescription: Dog treats serve a number of useful purposes. They help satisfy your dog’s need to chew, and they’re an indispensable part of training, especially for food-motivated pups. Crunchy biscuits and smaller treats can be given as training rewards or everyday snacks to strengthen the bond between you and your pet. Long-lasting dog treats are great for special occasions. They can help reduce stress as your dog chews or keep her occupied when guests visit. Every dog loves a good bone or bully stick, and a naturally shed antler will keep dogs chewing happily for hours. Treat-dispensing toys can add another layer of chewing fun.

descendents.name: Crates, Pens & Gates
descendents.longDescription: Though we wish we could take our pets with us everywhere we go, we often times can’t. Whether it be for when you’re away from home, or just a place to sleep, dog kennels give your dog a safe space of his own. By starting crate training early on, your dog will learn to enjoy his time in a crate without feeling distressed or panicked. Chewy offers a variety of crate mats that allow your dog to be more comfortable and make his cage feel homier. For some dogs, pens may be used as an alternative to crates, or can be used as a supervised play area. There are some basic categories of dog beds, each with its own benefits. Here's everything you need to know.

The standard dog beds many pet parents look to first are [dog pillow beds](https://www.chewy.com/b/pillow-beds-1457). These are essentially large pillows that add increased comfort over what a hard floor offers. Some are flat while others are made with bolsters - raised sides that add a dimension of cuddling comfort to your pup's nap time. [Elevated dog beds](https://www.chewy.com/b/elevated-cooling-beds-1459) are another popular style pets and pet parents love. They feature a metal frame with a cot-style design. These beds don't have pressure points like some other beds, making them extremely comfortable for your dog. And they're exceptionally great for dogs with hip or joint issues, or breeds prone to getting them. Since they're elevated, they allow air to flow beneath, which help keep your dog cooler -  which can be great for thick-coated dogs. And they're perfect for use indoors and outside. [Orthopedic dog beds](https://www.chewy.com/b/orthopedic-beds-1460) are the perfect option for older dogs with hip, joint, bone and mobility issues as well as dog breeds that tend to experience these kinds of health issues. They feature super soft, pressure-relieving padding and as with pillow beds, orthopedic dog beds are available either flat or with bolsters for an added dimension of comfort and security.

If you live in a drafty home or are looking for an outdoor bed for cooler days, [heated dog beds](https://www.chewy.com/b/heated-beds-1458) are your best bet. They will ensure your best friend stays warm and comfy in any condition. There are a few different methods for heating these beds that you'll want to consider when choosing one. Your dog loves to walk, but do you love walking your dog? If you are finding yourself being dragged around by your curious canine, tied up in leash knots, it’s probably time to start leash training. It may come as a surprise to first time pup parents, but dogs don’t naturally have leash skills. Leash skills must be taught, and the skill doesn’t always come easily. 
Dogs are naturally faster than us, and get excited when exploring the outdoors. Leash training helps your pup know not to pull ahead or lag behind you, even when there’s something engaging them outside. Get help training your furry friend with dog training collars, dog training leads and leashes from Chewy. Walking a big dog who isn’t leash trained can lead to accidents and injury. With the help of a training leash, you can get your pooch to prance alongside you, instead of around and through you. Chewy carries top dog training leash brands like PetSafe, Four Paws, Flexi and ThunderLeash. The Flexi training leash is a great training tool, because it’s easy to control. You can provide excess slack or reign in your pup quickly and with ease. The Four Paws training lead may look simple in comparison to other leashes, but it’s a great tool for leash training. The solid bronze clip swivels and adds extra durability, perfect for reigning in a dare devil dog.

descendents.name: Flea & Tick
descendents.shortDescription: Flea & Tick Treatment & Medicine for Dogs
descendents.longDescription:
Fleas and ticks. Is there anything worse than having these pests infest your pet and your home? We don’t think so. Let’s take a look at how you dog can get fleas and ticks and, more importantly, how you can prevent and get rid of them with safe, yet powerful, tick and flea treatment products.

Your dog can pick up fleas and ticks from other pets, from wildlife like squirrels, raccoons, chipmunks, deer or opossums, and from nature, generally tall grasses or bushes. When a female flea or tick living on an animal lays her eggs, they fall off onto the ground. When those eggs hatch and the larvae grow into adult fleas and ticks, they hop onto a host. And if pets cross their path, it will be them. After a dog becomes a tick or flea host, they can suffer some health risks, ranging from minor irritations to potentially deadly diseases.

When fleas bite a dog, their saliva leaves the skin irritated, leading to your dog itching and biting at the location. The irritation is uncomfortable to your dog and could even lead to her scratching to the point of fur loss. Fleas can also transmit tapeworms to your dog. Tapeworms are parasites that will live in your dog’s gut, leaching important nutrition from your dog’s diet. And then there’s ticks. When they latch onto a dog they can transmit a range of diseases—Lyme disease, rocky mountain spotted fever, tularemia and more. 

When it comes to getting rid of fleas and ticks, you have options. There are spot treatment solutions, collars, oral treatments, shampoos, sprays and wipes for your pet, as well as spray treatments and foggers for around your home and yard. It’s important to treat your home, yard and pet if you want to end an infestation for good. If your pet already has fleas or ticks, look for a solution that kills fleas and ticks at both the adult life stage and the larvae stage. This is important, because if your pet has fleas or ticks, there’s a good chance larvae are hiding in carpets, furniture, your lawn and even in your pet’s fur. Following the manufacturer’s guidelines for use and application will ensure your tick and flea treatment is swift and absolute. If you’d prefer to avoid these headaches all together, take some preventative measures before your dog even becomes a flea or tick host, like with topical or oral preventatives or with a dog flea and tick collar. You can find everything you need right here on Chewy, so take the necessary precautions to protect your pet today.

attachmentAssets.name: 621d2275-013b-4639-ab7a-e614749a343a
attachmentAssets.shortDescription: How do dog flea and tick treatments work?
attachmentAssets.longDescription: Dog flea and tick treatment works in different ways, and the method of action depends on which product you use. Flea shampoos and fast-acting chemical treatments kill fleas and ticks on contact but won’t prevent re-infestation. Topical and oral flea and tick treatments work by spreading over your pet’s skin and killing fleas and ticks on contact for up to a month. Many also include hormone growth regulators that prevent flea eggs and larvae from hatching and developing. These tend to be more effective long-term because they break the flea lifecycle and prevent parasite re-infestation.

attachmentAssets.name: 2f8cd141-0582-49fb-8def-fbede8ceebaf
attachmentAssets.shortDescription: What is the fastest way to get rid of fleas on a dog?
attachmentAssets.longDescription: The fastest way to get rid of fleas on a dog is with a flea shampoo or fast-acting pill treatment that kills fleas within hours. Careful flea combing can also rid your dog of existing fleas. These methods will get rid of any fleas that are currently on your dog, but you will need to apply a long-acting preventative to truly get rid of fleas by preventing re-infestation. A combination of approaches works best for both short and long-term flea control.

attachmentAssets.name: a5801b91-88da-484a-9855-665dff20836b
attachmentAssets.shortDescription: Does flea and tick prevention kill existing fleas and ticks?
attachmentAssets.longDescription: Most flea and tick prevention does kill existing fleas and ticks, but some products take time to show progress and break the persistent re-infestation cycle. For heavy infestations, multiple methods may work best initially to get the situation under control. Washing pet bedding, vacuuming, treating the home and yard and flea shampooing your pet may be recommended before beginning a topical, collar or oral flea prevention regimen. Your vet can give you guidance and recommend the best flea and tick treatment and prevention products for your situation.

attachmentAssets.name: b477b4f9-d2b1-4085-9179-0d702414294b
attachmentAssets.shortDescription: What do vets recommend for flea and tick control?
attachmentAssets.longDescription: Vets recommend long-acting topical or oral flea and tick control medications for most pets, but your pet may benefit from other flea and tick control measures instead. Younger or ailing pets may not be able to use topicals or oral flea and tick meds, and those with heavy infestations may require multiple measures to get the problem under control. Vets sometimes recommend flea shampoos, yard and home flea treatments, or flea combing for pet flea and tick control. Follow your vet’s flea control instructions closely and be sure to read all the instructions on your flea and tick products carefully.

attachmentAssets.name: 39c7ffab-7fc0-48f8-aa7a-4c756aff24a4
attachmentAssets.shortDescription: What are the best flea tick medicines for dogs?
attachmentAssets.longDescription: The best flea and tick medicines for dogs are products that provide continuous protection to keep your best friend safe and comfortable. Choose a product that is easy to administer, like a long-acting topical or oral flea control product, and consider options with added tick, heartworm or parasite protection built in. Your vet can advise you on the best flea and tick medicines for your dog and help you choose the one that’s right for your best friend.

attachmentAssets.shortDescription: Do dogs need clothes to stay warm?
attachmentAssets.longDescription: Some dogs need clothes to stay warm in cooler temperatures, especially if they are older, ailing or have a thinner coat. Other dogs may have thicker coats that are well-suited to colder climates. Keep an eye on your dog for signs that he is cold and talk to your vet about appropriate measures during cold weather activities.

attachmentAssets.name: 9e24e4d8-0d52-465e-aa18-cd217d1fd088
attachmentAssets.shortDescription: How do I measure clothes for my dog?
attachmentAssets.longDescription: Measure clothes for your dog by first measuring your dog’s neck girth, chest girth and topline/back measurement. Measure neck girth by positioning a tape measure around your dog’s neck right where he would wear a collar, remembering to leave it loose enough that you can fit two fingers under the tape. Do the same thing around the largest part of the chest, usually right behind the front legs, using the two finger rule as before. The topline measurement is the length from the base of the neck to where the tail begins. Always size up if your dog is in between sizes, and make sure any clothing is neither too tight nor too loose.

attachmentAssets.name: 10a5e693-eddb-4ed9-8c4d-8752a914fddf
attachmentAssets.shortDescription: Do dogs like wearing clothes?
attachmentAssets.longDescription: Some dogs do like wearing clothes, but every dog is different. Dogs with thicker coats may overheat in clothing, and others may simply find it unpleasant. Some dogs do enjoy wearing clothing, though, and it can be a nice way to warm your pup up in cooler temperatures. Acclimate your canine to wearing clothing gradually, and watch for any signs of distress or discomfort. Be sure not to leave your dog unattended while wearing clothing, especially if he is still getting used to wearing it.

descendents.name: Dog Tech & Smart Home
descendents.longDescription:
If we could, we’d choose to spend much more time with our pets—especially when they give us that look any time we have to leave the house. But we can’t always be there to keep an eye on them 24/7, or even to let them in and out the pet door in the middle of the night when they feel like going on an adventure. That’s where our pet tech products come in. So when you’re shopping for your monthly pet supplies, take a look at our pet tech gear. You’ll find efficient cat and dog monitors, including our best pet cameras, GPS dog collars and cat trackers. When you can’t be at home during the day, our automatic pet food dispensers make sure your pets are taken care of—sometimes through the touch of a button in a pet feeding app. And with electronic pet doors, they can come and go as they need. We’ve got pretty much everything you’d need to give your pets the most freedom while still keeping tabs on them and making sure they’re safe and well-fed.

Pet cameras are great for watching over all the pets in your household while you’re at work, or even just out running errands. Cat and dog webcams don’t just let you watch, but you can also interact with your furry friends with special features like two-way audio and Wi-Fi dog treat dispensers. For pets that have full range of the backyard, you can set up an electronic pet door that syncs with a device on their collars and stays locked when not in use. As soon as they’re out the door, a handy cat GPS or dog GPS system lets you know their whereabouts so they won’t stray too far. 

Discover these helpful pet tech devices at Chewy—you’ll find the perfect solution for taking care of your pets even when you’re not at home.

descendents.name: Gifts & Books
descendents.longDescription:
If you’re on our site, chances are that you have a fondness for dogs, and you probably know other dog lovers. With our large selection of dog books and gifts for dog lovers, there’s no excuse for not finding a doggie-themed present for the next birthday or special occasion. Of course, you don’t even need a particular reason to send dog lover gifts to friends and family.  

Put your dog pride on display with decals for your car, laptop or fridge that have interesting and funny sayings about pets. There are also magnets that you can attach to your car and easily remove, and they’re great as gifts for dog lovers. Choose from bone-shaped magnets that exclaim things like, “I Love My Mutt” or “Bad to the Bone.” If you’re going for a funnier vibe, you can get “The World Does Revolve Around My Dog” or “I Kiss My Dog on the Lips.” Anyone waiting at a light behind you is sure to get a chuckle.

Bookworms (whether that’s you or a friend) will enjoy our “pet library” that has dog books of all kinds. Even if you’re not so into books, you might find a great pet book that gives you training tips, grooming guides, potty training steps or breed information. We also have pet book memoirs, celebrity dog books, lighthearted tales about life with dogs, and emotional accounts of dogs overcoming the odds.  

You can pick out dog décor items to fill your home with pet happiness, including dog picture frames to show off your fur baby, wall art and pup-themed doormats. Or send dog lover gifts to friends and family as a nice surprise. We’ve got tons of pet parent favorites—just have a look, and you’re sure to find something that catches your eye.

descendents.name: Memorials & Keepsakes
descendents.longDescription:
For a pet parent, losing a beloved dog can be a devastating experience. You’ve cared for them as part of your extended family, and they’ve given you unconditional love and devotion. And whether you’ve known a pet since puppyhood or for just their senior years, you’ve probably shared more than a few happy and unforgettable moments. So of course you want to hang on to those cherished memories and keep them close to your heart. We understand that feeling, because we’re pet lovers, too. There are many ways to remember your pets and to celebrate their impact on your life, and some pet owners decide to commemorate their special furry family members with keepsakes like dog memorial stones, pet headstones, pet cremation jewelry or even urns for pets. And if you know someone who’s lost a pet, they might enjoy a thoughtful pet memorial gift like pet memorial plaques or special dog keepsakes. 

Let’s take a look at some of the options for preserving all the fun times you’ve had with your pooch. Some pet keepsakes have room for your favorite photo of your pet with an opening to display her collar, too. There are pet memorials that have inspirational sayings or poems around the frame, and others that feature your dog’s picture next to an imprint of her paw print. You can also opt for pet memorial jewelry like necklaces, lockets or pendants with a pet photo, and some of these double as dog urns that safely store your pet’s ashes. Another nice way to pay tribute to your loved one is with pet memorial stones or pet grave markers. They’re made of weatherproof materials like resin or natural stone with a thoughtful epitaph, and you can display them inside, use them as pet gravestones, or place them on a pathway outside or in your pet’s favorite place.

No matter which way you decide to honor your loving pet, Chewy’s here to help with beautiful and commemorative pet memorial stones, dog urns, pet cremation jewelry and dog memorial plaques.

attachmentAssets.shortDescription: What do you get someone when their dog passes?
attachmentAssets.longDescription: Get someone whose dog has passed a sympathy card or gift to show you care. A donation to a local shelter or dog charity in their name is usually a welcome gesture, as are flowers or personalized memorial gifts. A photo of the cherished pet in a keepsake frame is a thoughtful way to help memorialize a dog who has passed away, as well.

attachmentAssets.name: 5cd90835-98fe-4449-85a8-ba81eb073d89
attachmentAssets.shortDescription: What is a dog memorial?
attachmentAssets.longDescription: A dog memorial is a headstone, marker or other memorial object that can be used to remember a deceased canine. Choose from personalized memorials with pet names and dates in a variety of styles and sizes. Other memorials can include personalized plaques, keepsake photos in frames and urns for displaying ashes. Dog memorials are an important way we honor and remember our deceased canine friends.

attachmentAssets.name: 8160c6f9-2663-4b64-a124-061f55afd048
attachmentAssets.shortDescription: How do you honor a deceased dog?
attachmentAssets.longDescription: Honor a deceased pet in a way that feels meaningful for you and your family. Memorials and keepsake gifts can be a wonderful way to remember a pet that has passed away and help your family grieve appropriately. Many people choose to display pet photos in keepsake frames inside their home as memorials, or you can get a memorial stone to mark a grave or memorial spot in your garden. You can also find urns for keeping pet ashes safe, and many are tasteful and decorative for display. Explore all your options and see which one feels right for you.
